the exact length of the buffer to read
the maximum length of the output string

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: 1) Reads inlen characters of a buffer from the given kernel space memory address, and returns up to MAXSTRINGLEN characters, where any ASCII characters that are not printable are replaced by the corresponding escape sequence in the returned string. Note that the string will be surrounded by double quotes. On the rare cases when kernel space data is not accessible at the given address, the address itself is returned as a string, without double quotes.

2) Reads inlen characters of a buffer from the given kernel space memory address, and returns up to outlen characters, where any ASCII characters that are not printable are replaced by the corresponding escape sequence in the returned string. Note that the string will be surrounded by double quotes. On the rare cases when kernel space data is not accessible at the given address, the address itself is returned as a string, without double quotes.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: 1) Returns up to n characters of a C string from the given user space memory address where any ASCII characters that are not printable are replaced by the corresponding escape sequence in the returned string. Note that the string will be surrounded by double quotes. On the rare cases when userspace data is not accessible at the given address, the address itself is returned as a string, without double quotes.

2) Reads up to inlen characters of a C string from the given user space memory address, and returns up to outlen characters, where any ASCII characters that are not printable are replaced by the corresponding escape sequence in the returned string. Note that the string will be surrounded by double quotes. On the rare cases when userspace data is not accessible at the given address, the address itself is returned as a string, without double quotes.

chapter.title: Guru tapsets
chapter.para: Functions to deliberately interfere with the system's behavior, in order to inject faults or improve observability. All the functions in this tapset require the use of guru mode (-g).

refnamediv.refpurpose: millisecond delay

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: This function inserts a multi-millisecond busy-delay into a probe handler. It requires guru mode.

refnamediv.refpurpose: trigger a panic

listitem.para: message to pass to kernel's panic function

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: This function triggers an immediate panic of the running kernel with a user-specified panic message. It requires guru mode.

refnamediv.refpurpose: raise a signal in the current thread

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: This function calls the kernel send_sig routine on the current thread, with the given raw unchecked signal number. It may raise an error if send_sig failed. It requires guru mode.

refnamediv.refpurpose: microsecond delay

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: This function inserts a multi-microsecond busy-delay into a probe handler. It requires guru mode.

chapter.title: A collection of standard string functions
chapter.para: Functions to get the length, a substring, getting at individual characters, string seaching, escaping, tokenizing, and converting strings to longs.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Checks for a digit

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: Checks for a digit (0 through 9) as the first character of a string. Returns non-zero if true, and a zero if false.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Returns whether a string is a substring of another string

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: This function returns 1 if string s1 contains s2, otherwise zero.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Return a given matched subexpression.

listitem.para: index to the subexpression to return. 0 corresponds to the entire regular expression.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: returns the content of the n'th subexpression of the last successful use of the =~ regex matching operator. Returns an empty string if the n'th subexpression was not matched (e.g. due to alternation). Throws an error if the last use of =~ was a failed match, or if fewer than n subexpressions are present in the original regexp.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Return the last matched string.

refsection.title: Arguments
refsection.para: None

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: returns the string matched by the last successful use of the =~ regexp matching operator. Returns an error if the last use of =~ led to a failed match.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Number of subexpressions in the last match.

refsection.title: Arguments
refsection.para: None

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: returns the number of subexpressions from the last successful use of the =~ regex matching operator.

Note that this number includes subexpressions which are present in the regex but did not match any string; for example, given the regex a|(b), the subexpressions will count the group for (b) regardless of whether it matched a string or not. Throws an error if the last use of =~ was a failed match.

refnamediv.refpurpose: str_replace Replaces all instances of a substring with another

listitem.para: the string to search and replace in
the substring which is used to search in prnt_str string
the substring which is used to replace srch_str

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: This function returns the given string with substrings replaced.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Quotes a given string

listitem.para: The kernel address to retrieve the string from

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: Returns the quoted string version of the given string, with characters where any ASCII characters that are not printable are replaced by the corresponding escape sequence in the returned string. Note that the string will be surrounded by double quotes.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Returns the char at a given position in the string

listitem.para: the string to fetch the character from
the position to get the character from (first character is 0)

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: This function returns the character at a given position in the string or zero if the string doesn't have as many characters. Reports an error if pos is out of bounds.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Returns the length of a string

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: This function returns the length of the string, which can be zero up to MAXSTRINGLEN.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Returns location of a substring within another string

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: This function returns location of the first occurence of string s2 within s1, namely the return value is 0 in case s2 is a prefix of s1. If s2 is not a substring of s1, then the return value is -1.

refnamediv.refpurpose: strtol - Convert a string to a long

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: This function converts the string representation of a number to an integer. The base parameter indicates the number base to assume for the string (eg. 16 for hex, 8 for octal, 2 for binary).

refnamediv.refpurpose: Returns a substring

listitem.para: the string to take a substring from
starting position of the extracted string (first character is 0)

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: Returns the substring of the given string at the given start position with the given length (or smaller if the length of the original string is less than start + length, or length is bigger than MAXSTRINGLEN).

refnamediv.refpurpose: Escape any non-printable chars in a string

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: This function accepts a string argument, and any ASCII characters that are not printable are replaced by the corresponding escape sequence in the returned string.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Escape any non-printable chars in a string

listitem.para: maximum length of string to return (0 implies MAXSTRINGLEN)
put double quotes around the string. If input string is truncated it will have ... after the second quote

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: This function accepts a string of designated length, and any ASCII characters that are not printable are replaced by the corresponding escape sequence in the returned string.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Return the next non-empty token in a string

listitem.para: set of characters that delimit the tokens
string to tokenize. If empty, returns the next non-empty token in the string passed in the previous call to tokenize.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: 1) This function returns the next token in the string passed in the previous call to tokenize. If no delimiter is found, the entire remaining input string is * returned. It returns empty when no more tokens are available.

2) This function returns the next non-empty token in the given input string, where the tokens are delimited by characters in the delim string. If the input string is non-empty, it returns the first token. If the input string is empty, it returns the next token in the string passed in the previous call to tokenize. If no delimiter is found, the entire remaining input string is returned. It returns empty when no more tokens are available.

chapter.title: Utility functions for using ansi control chars in logs
chapter.para: Utility functions for logging using ansi control characters. This lets you manipulate the cursor position and character color output and attributes of log messages.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Move cursor to top left and clear screen.

refsection.title: Arguments
refsection.para: None

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: Sends ansi code for moving cursor to top left and then the ansi code for clearing the screen from the cursor position to the end.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Hides the cursor.

refsection.title: Arguments
refsection.para: None

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: Sends ansi code for hiding the cursor.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Move cursor to new coordinates.

listitem.para: Row to move the cursor to.
Colomn to move the cursor to.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: Sends ansi code for positioning the cursor at row x and column y. Coordinates start at one, (1,1) is the top-left corner.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Restores a previously saved cursor position.

refsection.title: Arguments
refsection.para: None

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: Sends ansi code for restoring the current cursor position previously saved with ansi_cursor_save.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Saves the cursor position.

refsection.title: Arguments
refsection.para: None

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: Sends ansi code for saving the current cursor position.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Shows the cursor.

refsection.title: Arguments
refsection.para: None

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: Sends ansi code for showing the cursor.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Move cursor to new line.

refsection.title: Arguments
refsection.para: None

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: Sends ansi code new line.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Resets Select Graphic Rendition mode.

refsection.title: Arguments
refsection.para: None

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: Sends ansi code to reset foreground, background and color attribute to default values.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Set the ansi Select Graphic Rendition mode.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: 1) Sends ansi code for Select Graphic Rendition mode for the given forground color. Black (30), Blue (34), Green (32), Cyan (36), Red (31), Purple (35), Brown (33), Light Gray (37).

2) Sends ansi code for Select Graphic Rendition mode for the given forground color, Black (30), Blue (34), Green (32), Cyan (36), Red (31), Purple (35), Brown (33), Light Gray (37) and the given background color, Black (40), Red (41), Green (42), Yellow (43), Blue (44), Magenta (45), Cyan (46), White (47).

3) Sends ansi code for Select Graphic Rendition mode for the given forground color, Black (30), Blue (34), Green (32), Cyan (36), Red (31), Purple (35), Brown (33), Light Gray (37), the given background color, Black (40), Red (41), Green (42), Yellow (43), Blue (44), Magenta (45), Cyan (46), White (47) and the color attribute All attributes off (0), Intensity Bold (1), Underline Single (4), Blink Slow (5), Blink Rapid (6), Image Negative (7).

refnamediv.refpurpose: returns an amount of space to indent

listitem.para: the amount of space added/removed for each call

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: This function returns a string with appropriate indentation. Call it with a small positive or matching negative delta. Unlike the thread_indent function, the indent does not track individual indent values on a per thread basis.

refnamediv.refpurpose: returns the global nested-depth

listitem.para: the amount of depth added/removed for each call

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: This function returns a number for appropriate indentation, similar to indent. Call it with a small positive or matching negative delta. Unlike the thread_indent_depth function, the indent does not track individual indent values on a per thread basis.

refnamediv.refpurpose: returns an amount of space with the current task information

listitem.para: the amount of space added/removed for each call

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: This function returns a string with appropriate indentation for a thread. Call it with a small positive or matching negative delta. If this is the real outermost, initial level of indentation, then the function resets the relative timestamp base to zero. The timestamp is as per provided by the __indent_timestamp function, which by default measures microseconds.

refnamediv.refpurpose: returns the nested-depth of the current task

listitem.para: the amount of depth added/removed for each call

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: This function returns an integer equal to the nested function-call depth starting from the outermost initial level. This function is useful for saving space (consumed by whitespace) in traces with long nested function calls. Use this function in a similar fashion to thread_indent, i.e., in call-probe, use thread_indent_depth(1) and in return-probe, use thread_indent_depth(-1)

chapter.title: SystemTap Translator Tapset
chapter.para: This family of user-space probe points is used to probe the operation of the SystemTap translator (stap) and run command (staprun). The tapset includes probes to watch the various phases of SystemTap and SystemTap's management of instrumentation cache. It contains the following probe points:

refnamediv.refpurpose: Adding kernel instrumentation module to cache

listitem.para: the path the .ko file is going to (incl filename)
the path the .ko file is coming from (incl filename)

refsection.title: Description

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: pass4.end fires just before the jump to cleanup if s.last_pass = 4

refnamediv.refpurpose: Starting stap pass5 (running the instrumentation)

refsection.para: pass5 fires just after the call to gettimeofday, just before the call to run_pass.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Finished stap pass5 (running the instrumentation)

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: pass5.end fires just before the cleanup label

refnamediv.refpurpose: Starting stap pass6 (cleanup)

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: pass6 fires just after the cleanup label, essentially the same spot as pass5.end

refnamediv.refpurpose: Finished stap pass6 (cleanup)

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: pass6.end fires just before main's return.

refnamediv.refpurpose: NFS client marking page as dirty

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: This probe attaches to the generic __set_page_dirty_nobuffers function. Thus, this probe is going to fire on many other file systems in addition to the NFS client.

refnamediv.refpurpose: NFS client begin to write data

listitem.para: end address of this write operation
offset within mapping, can used a page identifier and position identifier in the page frame
start address of this write operation

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: Occurs when write operation occurs on nfs. It prepare a page for writing, look for a request corresponding to the page. If there is one, and it belongs to another file, it flush it out before it tries to copy anything into the page. Also do the same if it finds a request from an existing dropped page

chapter.title: Speculation
chapter.para: This family of functions provides the ability to speculative record information and then at a later point in the SystemTap script either commit the information or discard it.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Write out all output related to a speculation buffer

listitem.para: of the buffer to store the information in

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: Output all the output for id in the order that it was entered into the speculative buffer by speculative.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Discard all output related to a speculation buffer

listitem.para: of the buffer to store the information in

refnamediv.refpurpose: Store a string for possible output later

listitem.para: buffer id to store the information in
string to write out when commit occurs

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: Add a string to the speculaive buffer for id.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Allocate a new id for speculative output

refsection.title: Arguments
refsection.para: None

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: The speculation function is called when a new speculation buffer is needed. It returns an id for the speculative output. There can be multiple threads being speculated on concurrently. This id is used by other speculation functions to keep the threads separate.

chapter.title: JSON Tapset
chapter.para: This family of probe points, functions, and macros is used to output data in JSON format. It contains the following probe points, functions, and macros:

refnamediv.refpurpose: Add an array

listitem.para: Array description. An empty string can be used.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: This function adds a array, setting up everything needed. Arrays contain other metrics, added with json_add_array_numeric_metric or json_add_array_string_metric.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Add a numeric metric to an array

listitem.para: The name of the array the numeric metric should be added to.
The name of the numeric metric.
Metric description. An empty string can be used.
Metic units. An empty string can be used.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: This function adds a numeric metric to an array, setting up everything needed.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Add a string metric to an array

listitem.para: The name of the array the string metric should be added to.
The name of the string metric.
Metric description. An empty string can be used.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: This function adds a string metric to an array, setting up everything needed.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Add a numeric metric

listitem.para: The name of the numeric metric.
Metric description. An empty string can be used.
Metic units. An empty string can be used.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: This function adds a numeric metric, setting up everything needed.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Add a string metric

listitem.para: The name of the string metric.
Metric description. An empty string can be used.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: This function adds a string metric, setting up everything needed.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Set the metric prefix.

listitem.para: The prefix name to be used.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: This function sets the prefix, which is the name of the base of the metric hierarchy. Calling this function is optional, by default the name of the systemtap module is used.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Output a numeric value for metric in an array.

listitem.para: The array index (as a string) indicating where to store the numeric value.
The name of the numeric metric.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: The json_output_array_numeric_value macro is designed to be called from the 'json_data' probe in the user's script to output a metric's numeric value that is in an array. This metric should have been added with json_add_array_numeric_metric.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Output a string value for metric in an array.

listitem.para: The array index (as a string) indicating where to store the string value.
The name of the string metric.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: The json_output_array_string_value macro is designed to be called from the 'json_data' probe in the user's script to output a metric's string value that is in an array. This metric should have been added with json_add_array_string_metric.

refnamediv.refpurpose: End the json output.

refsection.title: Arguments
refsection.para: None

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: The json_output_data_end macro is designed to be called from the 'json_data' probe from the user's script. It marks the end of the JSON output.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Start the json output.

refsection.title: Arguments
refsection.para: None

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: The json_output_data_start macro is designed to be called from the 'json_data' probe from the user's script. It marks the start of the JSON output.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Output a numeric value.

listitem.para: The name of the numeric metric.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: The json_output_numeric_value macro is designed to be called from the 'json_data' probe in the user's script to output a metric's numeric value. This metric should have been added with json_add_numeric_metric.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Output a string value.

listitem.para: The name of the string metric.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: The json_output_string_value macro is designed to be called from the 'json_data' probe in the user's script to output a metric's string value. This metric should have been added with json_add_string_metric.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Fires whenever JSON data is wanted by a reader.

refsection.title: Values
refsection.para: None

refsection.title: Context
refsection.para: This probe fires when the JSON data is about to be read. This probe must gather up data and then call the following macros to output the data in JSON format. First, json_output_data_start() must be called. That call is followed by one or more of the following (one call for each data item): json_output_string_value(), json_output_numeric_value(), json_output_array_string_value(), and json_output_array_numeric_value(). Finally json_output_data_end() must be called.

chapter.title: Output file switching Tapset
chapter.para: Utility function to allow switching of output files.

refnamediv.refpurpose: switch to the next output file

refsection.title: Arguments
refsection.para: None

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: This function sends a signal to the stapio process, commanding it to rotate to the next output file when output is sent to file(s).
